page.title: 07SHEPWAY ESTATE, MAIDSTONE
page.content: This is a large post-war council estate of 340 acres built around a central green and shopping centre. The site, once orchards, hops and blackberries, was cleared in 1946 and houses, maisonettes, flats and a small number of old people's bungalows have been built. A feature of the estate is the large number of communal areas of grassland. Garages were not a priority when the estate was originally built and cars now park on grass verges in many of the narrower roads, which are named after counties. In recent years the council has allowed tenants to purchase their rented property and a small percentage have done so. The estate has its own clinic and is well served by two churches, a branch library, a youth club, two primary schools, and frequent bus services.
